tldr: Q3 2025 revenue surged 15.4% QoQ to KRW 86.1T with operating profit of KRW 12.2T as memory sales hit a record and foundry utilization improved. Samsung guided mixed Q4 conditions, outlined a lower 2025 CapEx plan, and emphasized continued AI-led growth into 2026.
bullets: Revenue rose 15.4% QoQ to KRW 86.1T and operating profit jumped to KRW 12.2T for a 14.1% margin.
DS sales grew 19% QoQ with record memory revenue from HBM3E and server SSDs; DX revenue rose 11% on foldables.
Q3 CapEx was KRW 9.2T; full-year 2025 CapEx is projected at KRW 47.4T with dividend raised to KRW 370 per share.
themes: Memory recovery improving AI device component supply
Foundry utilization rebound supporting advanced-node output
Foldable momentum sustaining premium device demand
Capex reduction signals tighter component capacity
AI-led demand outlook remains the key driver

segments.title: Device Solutions (DS)
points: Sales increased 19% QoQ with record memory revenue led by HBM3E and server SSDs.
Foundry profitability improved on higher utilization and reduced one-off costs.

segments.title: Device eXperience (DX)
points: Revenue increased 11% QoQ on foldable launches and solid flagship sales.
MX expects premium-led growth but faces rising component costs in Q4.

guidance.label: Q4 outlook
guidance.note: AI memory strength offset by DX competition and tariffs

notes.title: Shareholder returns
points: Quarterly dividend of KRW 370 per share; KRW 2.45T payout due late November.
KRW 10T buyback program completed by Sep 29; remaining cancellations to be decided.

notes.title: Memory roadmap
points: HBM3E demand outpaced supply; HBM4 samples shipped with 11 Gbps-plus performance.
Management expects AI server demand to remain strong into 2026.

themes.title: HBM competitiveness
points: HBM3E shipments rose mid-80% QoQ; mix fully transitioned to HBM3E.
HBM4 samples shipped; capacity expansion under review.

themes.title: Foundry recovery
points: Losses narrowed on better utilization and fewer write-downs.
2nm GAA mass production started with expanding advanced node backlog.

top_questions.question: What is the memory outlook for 2026?
top_questions.summary: Management expects AI-driven demand to exceed supply, supporting higher HBM and server DRAM volumes.

top_questions.question: How did foundry profitability improve in Q3?
top_questions.summary: Reduced one-off costs and higher advanced-node utilization drove better results.

top_questions.question: Can MX sustain margins with rising component costs?
top_questions.summary: Samsung plans to lean on flagship mix, ecosystem products, and process optimization.

implications: Record memory performance reinforces Samsung's leverage to AI server demand cycles.
CapEx cuts signal discipline while protecting advanced node transitions.
competitive_notes: TV competition remains price-led, pushing Samsung to emphasize premium differentiation.
forecast_hooks: Track HBM4 commercialization timelines and capacity expansion decisions.
Monitor Q4 DS margin sustainability as HBM pricing volatility persists.

action_items: Validate HBM3E pricing trends versus conventional DRAM margin convergence.
Watch Q4 foundry utilization and 2nm ramp progress.
open_questions: Timing for cancellation of remaining repurchased shares.
Degree of tariff impact on DX demand in Q4.
watch_next_quarter: Q4 memory pricing trajectory for DRAM and NAND.
CapEx revisions if AI demand accelerates in 2026.
